name: Inevitable Tech
headline: To make food a renewable resource, for everyone
description: Iron Ox is redesigning agriculture to confront its staggering environmental impacts and adapting farming to meet our future needs by making it a precise science that lets plants reach their full potential.

![](https://inevitabletech.com/wp-content/themes/inevitable/assets/images/logomark.svg)
# Grow with Inevitable.
[ Scroll down ![](https://inevitabletech.com/wp-content/themes/inevitable/assets/images/icons/scroll-down.svg) ](https://inevitabletech.com/<#js-section-2>)
## Our Mission
We create the most advanced technology on the planet to give plants the best possible start to life.
## Our Vision
  * The future of sustainable agriculture is **Profitable** :
We help farms increase yields and avoid waste – starting with Clean Propagation, which reduces risk at the start of the growing cycle.
  * The future of sustainable agriculture is **Equitable** :
We serve farmers of all sizes and types – vertical, horizontal, Dutch glass, open field, hydroponic, or dry farming.
  * The future of sustainable agriculture is **Adaptable** :
We can help farms leverage data to maximize the productivity of every team member and mitigate the impacts of climate change.
  * The future of sustainable agriculture is **Inevitable**.
See how our technology can work for you – sales@inevitabletech.com.
    * 1
    * 2
    * 3
    * 4


![](https://inevitabletech.com/wp-content/themes/inevitable/assets/images/logomark.svg)
## We All Grow Here
![](https://inevitabletech.com/wp-content/themes/inevitable/assets/images/logo-word.svg)
## Technology
### Plant for abundance
Our teams are co-located in California and Texas, America’s top states for agricultural commodities. Our software, hardware, plant science and engineering teams are based in the global tech hubs of Silicon Valley and Austin. We test our products at a 283,332-sq ft facility in Lockhart, Texas – then customers deploy it; from nurseries to indoor growers, coast to coast.
![](https://inevitabletech.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/customer-1a.jpg) ![](https://inevitabletech.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/customer-2a.jpg)
Then we deploy our Clean Propagation technology to improve yields per acre and maximize productivity for farmers and their teams. 
Beyond the seedling, superior plant health and environment-specific intelligence helps farmers close the gap between demand, signal and production – improving yield, sustainability and profits. 
![](https://inevitabletech.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/customer-1b-scaled.jpg) ![](https://inevitabletech.com/177)
## Development Partners
See Who is Growing with Inevitable

![](https://inevitabletech.com/wp-content/themes/inevitable/assets/images/logomark.svg)
![](https://inevitabletech.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/tech.jpg)
## OUR TECH
Our teams are co-located in California and Texas, America’s top states for agricultural commodities. Our software, hardware, plant science and engineering teams are based in the global tech hubs of Silicon Valley and Austin. We test our products at a 283,332-sq ft facility in Lockhart, Texas – then customers deploy it; from nurseries to indoor growers, coast to coast.
[About Our Tech](https://inevitabletech.com/</technology>)
## Our Team
We’ve spent time in the most audacious companies across technology, transportation, energy and plant-science.
Together we are focused on agriculture as the most important lever our planet can pull.
[About Our Team](https://inevitabletech.com/</team>)

generated_description:
**Inevitable Tech: Redefining Agriculture for a Sustainable Future**

Founded in 2015 and rooted in the innovative grounds of Y Combinator's W16 batch, Inevitable Tech (formerly known as Iron Ox) is on a mission to transform food into a renewable resource for all. Based out of San Carlos, California, and with a dedicated team of 80, they are tackling the pressing challenges of modern agriculture: unsustainable practices and the looming impacts of climate change.

At its core, Inevitable Tech believes in the power of advanced technology to revolutionize farming. They focus on creating conditions that allow plants not just to survive, but to thrive. This approach is encapsulated in their commitment to "Clean Propagation," a method that significantly reduces risk during the growing cycle and maximizes crop yields while minimizing waste. Their vision isn't just about profit; it emphasizes equity and adaptability, aiming to serve farmers across various cultivation methods—be it vertical farms, hydroponics, or traditional field farming.

The company operates facilities in both California and Texas, utilizing cutting-edge technology and data-driven practices to optimize productivity. Their 283,332 square foot testing facility in Lockhart, Texas, exemplifies their commitment to rigorous product evaluation before it reaches farmers' hands.

Led by a team with extensive experience in technology and plant science, including founder David Lee and CEO Lucianne Kempton, Inevitable Tech is setting a robust example in the agricultural landscape. They collaborate with various partners like Revol Greens and AppHarvest, further exemplifying the growing demand for sustainable farming solutions.

In a world increasingly aware of environmental impact, Inevitable Tech not only promises a future of sustainable agriculture but is actively building it, ensuring that the food we eat can be renewed, equitable, and resilient. For those interested in learning more or looking to collaborate, Inevitable Tech encourages getting in touch via their [website](https://inevitabletech.com/) or reaching out directly to their inquiry emails. 

In short, the future of farming might look uncertain, but with companies like Inevitable Tech leading the charge, it seems inevitable that positive change is just around the corner.
